teamScheduler.title: Team Scheduler
teamScheduler.description: Smart platform to organize availability, shifts and events with AI suggestions. –60% planning time, +40% participation.

challenge.title: The challenge
challenge.description: A distributed team across multiple locations struggled to coordinate availability, shifts, and recurring events. The manual process required hours of weekly work and generated conflicts.
points: Manual availability collection via email and shared spreadsheets
Frequent shift conflicts and event overlaps
No real-time visibility on who is available and when
Low participation in recurring events due to lack of effective reminders

solution.title: The solution
solution.description: We designed and developed a platform that centralizes availability, shifts, and events. AI integration automatically suggests optimal slots and reduces conflicts.

features.title: Unified dashboard
features.description: Centralized view of availability, assigned shifts, and upcoming events. Filters by team, location, and role.

features.title: AI suggestions
features.description: The algorithm analyzes history and preferences to suggest optimal slots, avoiding conflicts and balancing workload.

features.title: Smart notifications
features.description: Automatic reminders via email and push, synced with external calendars (Google Calendar, Outlook).

features.title: Real-time updates
features.description: WebSocket for live updates when someone modifies availability or confirms an event.

results.title: Results
results.summary: The team recovered valuable hours every week and drastically reduced conflicts. Event participation increased thanks to timely notifications and simplified UX.

energyIntelligence.title: Energy Intelligence
energyIntelligence.description: Advanced energy monitoring and device detection via NILM models. –25% energy inefficiencies in 2 months.

challenge.title: The challenge
challenge.description: A group of facility managers had limited visibility into actual energy consumption. Existing data was aggregated and didn't allow identifying waste or anomalous devices.
points: Monitoring limited to global meters, without device-level detail
Inability to detect anomalies in real-time
No predictive system to optimize future consumption
Difficulty justifying investments in energy efficiency

solution.title: The solution
solution.description: We implemented a monitoring platform with NILM (Non-Intrusive Load Monitoring) models that identify individual devices from aggregated consumption. Predictive dashboard and real-time alerts.

features.title: NILM Engine
features.description: PyTorch models trained on real datasets to disaggregate consumption and detect active devices without additional sensors.

features.title: Predictive dashboard
features.description: D3.js visualizations with weekly consumption forecasts, anomaly alerts, and benchmarks between facilities.

features.title: Smart alerts
features.description: Automatic notifications when a device consumes above threshold or shows anomalous patterns.

features.title: TimeSeries DB
features.description: Optimized storage for high-frequency time series, with configurable retention policies.

results.title: Results
results.summary: Facility managers gained granular visibility into consumption, identifying hidden waste and optimizing investments. The infrastructure ROI paid for itself in less than 6 months.

aiWorkflowAssistant.title: AI Workflow Assistant
aiWorkflowAssistant.description: Intelligent automations for ticketing and knowledge base with Slack/Trello integrations. –50% repetitive ticket handling time.

challenge.title: The challenge
challenge.description: An internal support team handled hundreds of weekly tickets, many repetitive. The knowledge base was static and rarely consulted. Slack and Trello didn't communicate.
points: Repetitive tickets requiring identical manual responses
Static textual knowledge base, difficult to navigate
No synchronization between Slack (communication) and Trello (task tracking)
Time lost searching for solutions already provided in the past

solution.title: The solution
solution.description: We built an AI assistant that analyzes incoming tickets, suggests responses based on history, and automatically creates Trello tasks. Living knowledge base powered by Vector DB.

features.title: AI Triage
features.description: LLM analyzes incoming tickets, classifies by priority, and suggests draft responses based on semantic embeddings.

features.title: Living Knowledge Base
features.description: Vector DB indexes resolved tickets and documents. Semantic search with real-time contextual results.

features.title: Slack ↔ Trello sync
features.description: Slack commands that automatically create Trello cards, update status, and notify the team.

features.title: Auto-resolution
features.description: For common tickets (password reset, access), AI responds and closes autonomously if the solution is validated.

results.title: Results
results.summary: The support team recovered valuable time, drastically reducing repetitive ticket handling. The knowledge base became a daily consulted asset.
